qas.question: Where did glasswork begin relatively late?
In what year did glassmaking begin in Asia?
What city was a center of glass production for the Romans?
In what current country is Trier located?
Where did ceramics begin in Asia?
In what year did glassmaking begin in Germany?
What city was a center of metal work for the Romans?
In what current country were Late Bronze Age civilizations located?

context: Glass remained a luxury material, and the disasters that overtook Late Bronze Age civilizations seem to have brought glass-making to a halt. Indigenous development of glass technology in South Asia may have begun in <a2_0><b7_0>1730 BCE<b7_0/><a2_0/>. In ancient <a1_0><b6_0><b9_0>China<b9_0/><b6_0/><a1_0/>, though, glassmaking seems to have a late start, compared to ceramics and metal work. The term glass developed in the late Roman Empire. It was in the Roman glassmaking center at <a3_0><b8_0>Trier<b8_0/><a3_0/>, now in modern <a4_0>Germany<a4_0/>, that the late-Latin term <a0_0><b5_0>glesum<b5_0/><a0_0/> originated, probably from a Germanic word for a transparent, lustrous substance. Glass objects have been recovered across the Roman empire in domestic, industrial and funerary contexts.[citation needed]
